text: hi everyone on this episode of sweet
talk I'm making peach cream cheese hand
pies because if there's anything better
than pie it's a mini personal pie that
you can take with you so I'll start with
my filling I have some peaches already
chopped here this is about two peaches
it's 1 and 3/4 cups chopped I'm going to
reserve 1/2 cup of the filling cut that
aside next I'll add the rest to my pot
mix on I'm adding 3 tablespoons of
granulated sugar and 2 tablespoons of
all-purpose flour and just a pinch of
salt this helps really bring out the
sweetness of the peaches next I'll stir
this constantly until it comes to a boil
basically what's going to happen is the
sugar will melt and combined with the
juices from the peaches and then when
that comes to a boil we'll just cook it
for about 30 seconds so this looks good
it's been bubbling and thickened a lot
now I'm going to take this off of the
heat transfer it to a heat proof Bowl
look how thick that is it's really crazy
how that transformed the peaches and now
I will let this cool completely for
about 30 minutes while my strip feeling
cools I'm going to make the cream cheese
part of the filling this is half a block
of cream cheese which is 4 ounces I'm
going to mash this up a little bit make
it a little bit easier to stir
everything together
this is room temperature which helps a
little bit when stirring everything
together but I'm also just going to give
it a good mash to get it going to this
I'm adding a quarter teaspoon of freshly
grated lemon zest that's about a quarter
of a lemon I like using these handy
microplane graders for this I find that
the tart lemon works really well with
the sweetness of the peaches I'm also
adding two tablespoons of sugar 1 egg
yolks and a pinch of salt
mixing this together the egg yolks helps
make this kind of a custard II creamy
filling now that this is combined I'm
adding one tablespoon of flour and three
tablespoons of sweetened shredded
coconut give this one more stir all
right this looks good our cream cheese
filling is ready I think we're ready to
roll out the dough so I have here one
pound of all butter puff pastry I got
this from the store this is kind of my
shortcut for using pie dough you could
certainly use your favorite recipe for
pie dough but I think this is kind of a
nice way to cut out a step so I'm going
to roll this out to a twelve and a half
by 16 and a half inch rectangle make
sure you have lots of flour down here so
it doesn't stick puff pastry can get
very sticky especially as it gets warm
so now I'm going to trim this so that
will be even rectangles
and now I'm dividing this into eight
rectangles for eight hand pies now I'll
transfer these onto my baking sheet this
will help me be able to chill them for a
little bit until they're nice and firm
will be a lot easier to work with so I'm
going to show these in the freezer for
about 20 minutes
these puff pastry rectangles are nice
and chilled they're ready to sell so I'm
just going to finish off my fruit
filling by adding my reserved 1/2 cup of
peaches and also a little bit of lemon
juice I'm keen about a teaspoon here
make sure I schedule disease the fresh
peaches are going to add a great texture
and then the lemon juice adds just a bit
of brightness to the filling alright
that looks good
so to start filling these I'm just
dividing the cream cheese amongst eight
pastry now that the cream cheese filling
is down and going to put the fruit
filling divide these among the pastries
[Music]
you don't need much in here because the
filling kind of expands while the
pastries bake and if you put too much
into your hand pie then it explodes and
you're going to have juice all over your
baking sheet instead of inside your pies
you want to make sure that you don't put
too much in now I'm ready to seal these
to do that I'm making an egg wash
[Music]
now I'll just fold the pastry over
making a little pocket around the fruit
filling
[Music]
now I'm just going to crimp the edges
with the tines of a fork just make sure
that everything gets sealed together so
while I have been rolling these out I
had my oven preheating to 400 next I'm
just going to cut event into the top of
the pastry this will allow some of the
steam to escape also helping it so it
doesn't explode and now I'm just
brushing the tops with egg wash this
gives a really nice shiny golden crust
they will look really beautiful when
they come out of the oven you can always
sprinkle these with a little sanding
sugar or something I think they look
really pretty the way they are with just
a little egg wash that's all I'll do
them today all right how cute are these
so I'm going to freeze these for about
20 minutes so they're nice and firm when
they're ready to go in the oven and then
I'm putting them into my oven for about
35 minutes
so I pulled these out of the oven they
are beautiful puffed and golden brown
and I let them cool completely on a wire
rack I know it's so difficult but you
have to do it look at these they are
flaky gooey filled with fruits I think
these are the perfect packing go dessert
you can bring them to a picnic a swim
meet a soccer game what have you is just
another amazing way to enjoy summer
fruit so flaky and delicious buttery
pretty
[Music]
